session_info.title: Energizing Morning Yoga Flow
session_info.description: Start your day with gentle movement and mindful breathing to energize body and mind

preparation.space: Quiet area with enough room to stretch arms wide
preparation.mindset: Set intention for your day ahead
cautions: Move slowly and listen to your body
Modify as needed for your flexibility level
Stop if you feel pain or dizziness

warm_up.purpose: Gently prepare the body for movement

poses.name: Seated Mountain Pose
poses.instructions: Sit cross-legged with spine tall, hands resting on knees. Close eyes and take 5 deep breaths, feeling your connection to the earth.
poses.breathing: Inhale for 4 counts, pause briefly, exhale for 4 counts
poses.benefits: Centers the mind, establishes breath awareness

poses.name: Neck Rolls
poses.instructions: Slowly drop right ear toward right shoulder, roll chin to chest, then left ear to left shoulder. Reverse direction. 3 times each way.
poses.breathing: Natural breath, exhale as you roll down

poses.name: Shoulder Rolls
poses.instructions: Roll shoulders up, back, and down in large circles. Feel the shoulder blades moving. 5 times backward, 5 times forward.
poses.breathing: Inhale as you lift shoulders, exhale as you release

main_flow.structure: Complete sequence twice, second round adding variations

poses.name: Cat-Cow Pose
poses.instructions: On hands and knees, arch spine looking up (Cow), then round spine dropping head (Cat). Move slowly with breath.
poses.breathing: Inhale to arch (Cow), exhale to round (Cat)
poses.benefits: Warms spine, improves flexibility, massages organs
poses.modifications: Use forearms instead of hands if wrists hurt

poses.name: Downward Facing Dog
poses.instructions: Tuck toes under, lift hips up and back creating inverted V. Press hands firmly down, lengthen spine.
poses.breathing: 5 deep breaths, focus on lengthening through spine
poses.benefits: Strengthens arms and legs, stretches hamstrings, energizes
poses.modifications: Bend knees if hamstrings are tight, use blocks under hands

poses.name: Forward Fold
poses.instructions: Step feet toward hands, hang forward with soft knees. Let arms dangle, gently sway side to side.
poses.breathing: Natural breath, feel release with each exhale
poses.benefits: Calms nervous system, stretches back and legs
poses.modifications: Bend knees generously, hold opposite elbows

poses.name: Mountain Pose
poses.instructions: Roll up slowly vertebra by vertebra to standing. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, arms at sides.
poses.breathing: 3 deep breaths, feeling grounded and centered
poses.benefits: Improves posture, creates stability and focus
poses.alignment: Equal weight on both feet, crown reaching toward sky

poses.name: Warrior I
poses.instructions: Step left foot back 3 feet, turn it out 45 degrees. Bend right knee over ankle, arms reach up. Hold, then switch sides.
poses.breathing: Strong, steady breaths, breathe into the pose
poses.benefits: Builds strength and focus, opens hip flexors
poses.modifications: Use wall for balance, hands on hips instead of up

flow_variations.round_2: Add gentle twists in Warrior I, hold poses 30 seconds longer

cool_down.purpose: Integrate the practice and prepare for your day

poses.name: Child's Pose
poses.instructions: Knees wide, big toes touching, fold forward resting forehead on mat. Arms can reach forward or rest by sides.
poses.breathing: Long, slow breaths, feeling completely supported
poses.benefits: Calms nervous system, gently stretches hips and back

poses.name: Savasana
poses.instructions: Lie on back, arms at sides with palms up. Let your whole body completely relax into the earth.
poses.breathing: Natural breath, simply observe without controlling
poses.benefits: Integrates the practice, reduces stress, centers mind

closing.affirmation: I am energized and ready for my day
closing.intention: Carry this sense of groundedness and energy with you
closing.transition: Slowly wiggle fingers and toes, gently open eyes

daily_tips: Listen to your body and modify as needed
Set a positive intention for your day
Combine with meditation or breathwork for deeper benefits
